questions.question: What is the major drawback of this experiment?

answers.a: It does not take the cohesive soil not account
answers.b: It does not take capillary into account
answers.d: It does not take into account the shear force

questions.question: Which instrument is used for putting soil into the cone?
The stopwatch should be started after ________.
The test is majorly used for ________.

answers.a: To determine the site suitability for the waste-water treatment facility
answers.b: To determine the compatibility of soil for the foundation
answers.c: To determine the site suitability of the soil for the dam
answers.d: To determine the site suitability of the soil for the retaining wall

questions.question: The reading of the graduated cylinder is _________.

answers.a: The difference between lower meniscuses of the liquid
answers.b: The difference between the upper meniscuses of the liquid

questions.question:
Select the correct ascending order for the following steps _________.
I. Place the graduated cylinder below the funnel
II. Take a funnel and put it on a funnel stand
III. Take the soil sample and put it in the funnel

Select the correct descending order for the following steps_________.
I. Take a known amount of quantity of water (say 100 ml) and pour it slowly over the soil in the funnel
II. Start the stopwatch
III. Note down the amount collected in the cylinder after a known time and fine the percolation rate of the sample.
Which of the following apparatus is  NOT used in this experiment _________.
